name: 薪酬管理研究
goals: Discuss the strategic importance of compensation to the achievement of organizational goals.
Discuss the role of compensation in attracting, motivating, and retaining a high-quality workforce.
Explain how job analyses and evaluations shape internal compensation structure.
Discuss how external competitiveness and market forces influence compensation.
Acquire basic competencies required for the development and management of compensation systems, e.g., job evaluation, salary survey, etc.
Design an appropriate compensation structure taking into consideration both internal equity and external competitiveness.
Discuss the effectiveness of benefit programs, incentive plans and pay-for-performance.
Discuss recent theoretical and practical developments in the area of compensation and benefits.

methodologies.note: Lectures will introduce students to the central topics of Compensation Management in the organization.
Class discussion will cover issues, trends and controversies of pay, incentives and benefits.
Students will apply subjects learned to a real-life company in a final project.
Students, in groups, will conduct a final project to develop the compensation system for a case company.

grading.note: Mid-term exam will cover subject matters introduced in the class.
Students are encouraged to actively participate in classroom discussion.
Final project requires students to develop a compensation system for a case company.
